result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Elijah Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
10-04-2016/ Judge Dennis R Cimpl
The Court ordered that the restitution order and restitution surcharges under Wis Stat 973.20(11)(a) and 973.06(1)(g) are vacated (See OTHER Conditions).

-Court waives all court costs and supervision fees due to restitution amount imposed. Pay DNA surcharges on Count2 and waives the DNA surcharge on Count 3 due to restitution amount imposed.
-If revoked, the Court ordered that all surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work, good time to apply, with a report date on 12-07-2015.

supervisions.notes: Same conditions apply as to Count 2.

miscConds.notes:
08-26-2016/ Judge Dennis R Cimpl
The Court ordered the JOC shall be amended by vacating the DNA surcharge on count three; however, the defendant remains responsible for the single DNA surcharge on count two.  All other sentencing orders shall remain in effect.

records.addlTxt: Per Order Dated October 31, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP2278-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21 IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Carly M. Cusack is relieved of further representation of Scott in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition will not be published.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Loretta Scott.
LETTER FROM DEFENDANT WIFE LORETTA SCOTT, REQUESTING CHILDCARE. kl

Defendant Leroy Elijah Scott in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
As to Count 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  
These sentences are consecutive to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on 4 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 90 days in the House of Correction with huber for work, good time to apply, with a report date on 12/7/2015.
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $30,630.12 to the  Wisconsin Child Support Trust Fund by monthly payments of $250.00 per month commencing 1/1/2016 until paid in full.  Restitution to be paid first.
Pay DNA surcharges on Count 2 and waives the DNA surcharge on Count 3 due to restitution amount imposed
Court waives all court costs and supervision fees due to restitution amount imposed
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Letter from Cotina V
documents in support of defendant
Sentencing Referral form

Appearances remain the same.  As to Counts 2 & 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
As to Counts 1 & 4:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed and read in the counts.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19 on 11/23/2015 at 8:30 am.
